response.answer_text: Drawing on my own experience, self-education is basically a self-directed, life-long and life-wide learning process, based on one's own chosen interests. My own learning pursuit actually started after I was given the book, 'Peak Learning', by Ronald Gross, as a gift by my PhotoReading co-developer and lead instructor, also my sensei, Patricia Danielson, from New England, USA back in the early 90's. In the ensuing year or so, I encountered another fine book, 'Self-University', by Charles Hayes. One of my three initial entrepreneurial projects after leaving the corporate world for good during the early 90's was setting up of an unique bookstore, aptly called 'The Brain Resource', which helped to fuel - and bankroll - my self-education through books, audios, videos, and other related resources.  It came under the umbrella of my registered company, 'Optimum Performance Technologies', which also included my strategy consulting and training development outfits, with seminar/workshop promotion. What I had learned in my self-education - I often like to call it, "Learning from the Masters" -  went naturally into my strategy consulting and training development, which served as convenient "testing grounds". That's how I got my moniker, Knowledge Adventurer & Technology Explorer, which I have used till today. In my view, the most important prerequisite in self-education is the drawing up of a learning agenda or game plan, with specific goals and objectives, metrics for measuring progress, myriad resources needed to produce results, and a timetable.   It should be evolving in order to keep it relevant to changing times and market dynamics. My personal interests, as part of my self-education, is very broad, almost from A to Z: accelerated self-growth, brainpower maximisation, cognitive fitness, through multiple intelligences, opportunity recognition, problem finding, all the way to X-factor development, yoga and zestful energy engineering. In the process, I have had the wonderful opportunity to meet many "giants on whose shoulders I now stand", who became great friends or associates. Compared to my early years in the early 90's, the implementaion and execution of self-education today is much breezier and faster and even cheaper, especially with Google search engine and the Internet, even though self-learners today have ostensibly more digital distractions. Nonetheless, to end this post, I like to take this opportunity to append a quick round-up of incredible resources for self-education and lifelong learning online: http://www.diygenius.com/100-self-education-resources-for-lifelong-learners/ http://www.diygenius.com/mind-expanding-documentaries/ http://www.diygenius.com/biohacking-genius-documentary/

Definition of self-education (merriam-webster) : the act or process of educating oneself by one's own efforts especially through reading and informal study. To acquire the (desired) skills or knowledge through self-education.  20 Steps Towards More Self-Directed Learning | InformED Our world is changing and changing rapidly. To be an active participant in our exciting global and digital world, one must not only have the pre-requistes of 3 R’s - reading, writing, and arithmetic, but also aspire to master the 4 C’s – creativity, critical thinking, communication, and collaboration. The learning platforms for building skills and knowledge are: Acquiring formal education through schools, vocational institutes and universities, a necessary preparation for many traditional 9–5 jobsGoing to the library and learning new things or upgrading your pool of knowledge by reading booksSigning up to relevant courses offered by many good learning platforms like coursera, udemySearching for relevant and trustworthy information through internet search engine like Google or watching self help videos (like TED Talks)Working in desired industry and profession to acquire the necessary and relevant knowledge and skillsEveryone is a unique person in some way, starting from nature genetics to nurture upbringing to problem faced in a situation in one’s life. One could gather tips on how to do this or that thing better from one or more of the above learning platforms but not adopting wholesale. Self-education is more than acquiring skills and knowledge from outside sources. It is about independent learning and knowing one’s strengths and weaknesses. It is about what you really are and what you want out of it. Make the best of what nature bestow to oneself, adapts and makes change for a “better” you! Give yourself permission to explore and develop your own talents and interests and work toward creating your own job as a professional in your chosen career or becoming a lifestyle entrepreneur.
